data.ans: Biological process by which organisms produce offspring.
Reproduction without fusion of gametes; offspring genetically identical.

data.que: Give two examples of asexual reproduction.
data.ans: Binary fission in amoeba and budding in hydra.
Involves fusion of male and female gametes to form a zygote.
Specialised reproductive cell (sperm or egg) involved in sexual reproduction.
Fusion of male and female gametes to form a zygote.

data.que: Differentiate between internal and external fertilisation.
data.ans: Internal: inside body (e.g., mammals); external: outside body in water (e.g., fishes).
Diploid cell formed by fusion of gametes; begins development into embryo.
Ovulation: release of ovum; menstruation: shedding of uterine lining if no fertilisation.
Transfer of pollen from anther to stigma in flowering plants.
Self: pollen to same flower/plant; cross: pollen to different plant of same species.
Asexual reproduction in plants using vegetative parts like stems, roots, leaves.

data.que: Give one advantage of sexual reproduction.
data.ans: Generates variation which aids adaptation and evolution.

data.que: Give one advantage of asexual reproduction.
data.ans: Rapid population increase without the need for mating.
Male and female reproductive organs producing sperm and ova respectively.
Production of genetically identical individuals artificially from a single cell.
Early developmental stage after zygote division leading to a new organism.
Major change in form during development (e.g., caterpillar to butterfly).

data.que: Why is genetic variation important in sexual reproduction?
data.ans: Provides diverse traits which improve survival under changing conditions.
Introduction of semen into the female reproductive tract.
Organ in pregnant mammals that supplies nutrients and oxygen to the fetus.

data.que: Name a reproductive adaptation in plants for pollination.
data.ans: Bright flowers to attract pollinators like insects and birds.
Alternating generations in plants: gametophyte produces gametes, sporophyte produces spores.
Development of an egg without fertilisation (seen in some insects).
To create offspring with genetic variation and adaptability.
